member.name: T:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Delegates.LayerFactory
member.summary: A that represents a factory that produces instances of a specific layer type, with user-defined parameters. This wrapper acts as an intemediary to streamline the user-side C# sintax when building up a new network structure, as all the input details for each layer will be automatically computed during the network setup.
member.param: The for the inputs of the upcoming network layer
member.remarks: It is also possible to invoke a instance just like any other to immediately get an value

member.name: T:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ActivationType
member.summary: Indicates an activation function to use in a neural network

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ActivationType.Sigmoid
member.summary: The sigmoid function, 1 / (1 + e^(-x))

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ActivationType.Tanh
member.summary: The tanh function, (e^x - e^(-x)) / (e^x + e^(-x))
member.remarks: It has the advantage of being centered vertically at the origin, instead of being shifted upwards like the classic sigmoid function

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ActivationType.LeCunTanh
member.summary: A customized tanh function proposed by LeCun (http://yann.lecun.com/exdb/publis/pdf/lecun-98b.pdf)

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ActivationType.ReLU
member.summary: The linear rectified function, max(0, x)
member.remarks: It doesn't saturate like the sigmoid or tanh function and it converges faster

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ActivationType.LeakyReLU
member.summary: The leaky ReLU function, max(0.01x, x)
member.remarks: It has the advance of having a nonzero gradient for negative values of x, so a negative neuron won't be stuck there during the rest of the training

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ActivationType.AbsoluteReLU
member.summary: The absolute linear rectified function, |x|
member.remarks: It can perform well with images when the dataset contains samples with different brightness levels

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ActivationType.Softmax
member.summary: The softmax function, e^x/sum{k}(e^x(k))

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ActivationType.Softplus
member.summary: The softplus function, ln(1 + e^x)

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ActivationType.ELU
member.summary: The exponential linear unit function, [{ x, x positive}, { e^x - 1, otherwise}];

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ActivationType.Identity
member.summary: A linear activation function that just returns the input value

member.name: T:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.BiasInitializationMode
member.summary: An indicating an initialization mode for the biases in a network layer

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.BiasInitializationMode.Zero
member.summary: All the bias values are initially set to 0

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.BiasInitializationMode.Gaussian
member.summary: Every bias value is assigned from a gaussian distribution ~N(0, 1)

member.summary: A computation graph node with an associated that processes an input

member.summary: The root node for a training sub-graph, a secondary training branch used during backpropagation to inject partial gradients

member.summary: A computation graph node that merges a series of inputs by summing their values together

member.summary: A simple indicating the type of convolution operation to perform

member.summary: The default convolution mode, with the kernel taargeting pixels in the opposite position

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ConvolutionMode.CrossCorrelation
member.summary: The cross-correlation mode (equivalent to a convolution with a flipped kernel)

member.name: T:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ExecutionModePreference
member.summary: Indicates the preferred mode of execution for all expensive operations in the library

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ExecutionModePreference.Cpu
member.summary: Only CPU-powered functions are executed. This means that network layers are deserialized through the class, and that all other computations will only be scheduled on the CPU.

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ExecutionModePreference.Cuda
member.summary: CUDA-powered functions are supported. When using this mode, network layers are deserialized through the class, and all other available operations will be scheduled on the GPU.

member.summary: The individual pixel values are mapped in the [0,1] range

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ImageNormalizationMode.Normal
member.summary: The individual pixel values are mapped in the [-1,1] range

member.name: F:NeuralNetworkNET.APIs.Enums.ImageNormalizationMode.None
member.summary: No normalization is applied, and all the pixel values are loaded with their original value
